name: Aurora KaneVax
notes:
Open to all Illinois residents 12 and older. (Residents that are 12-17 years of age will need a guardian to accompany them to give consent.)

Online registration and onsite registration are available. Walk-ins are also welcome, subject to vaccine availability.

Residents will not be turned away for not having identification. 

There is a standby list for any remaining first shot doses they MAY have after the clinics. If interested in being on this list, please email McalisterKierra@co.kane.il.us and provide a phone number.

name: Des Plaines Mass Vaccination Site
notes: WALK-INs allowed M-F from 8am-8pm and Saturday from 8am-6pm. All Illinois residents 12+ may be vaccinated at this site. Call 833-308-1988 to check for appointments or secure an appointment on the website. Must sign up on website ahead of time for registration code.  (NOTE: 12-18 years may only receive the Pfizer vaccine and must be accompanied by parent or guardian.)

name: Swedish Hospital
notes:
Age 12 Years and Over are Now Eligible at Swedish Hospital for COVID-19 Vaccination
Everyone 12 years and older is now eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine at Swedish Hospital. You do not have to be a current Swedish patient.
Parents of patients 12-17 years old will need to sign up for Family Access using their own NorthShoreConnect account:
If you are unable to use the NorthShoreConnect patient portal, please call Swedish Hospital’s COVID Vaccine and Testing Helpline at 773-907-7700 for assistance
